meanings.definition: To move or progress by crawling outwards.
meanings.sent1: The baby outcrawled from the blanket to the toy.
meanings.sent2: The spider outcrawled from under the bed to the corner.
meanings.sent3: The snail outcrawled the turtle in the race.
meanings.sent4: The ant outcrawled its competitors to reach the food first.
meanings.sent5: The caterpillar outcrawled along the leaf, inching closer to the edge.

meanings.sent1: The determined toddler outcrawled his siblings in the race.
meanings.sent2: The athlete outcrawled his opponents to win the crawling competition.
meanings.sent3: The sloth outcrawled the hare in the slowest crawl contest.
meanings.sent4: The snake outcrawled the other reptiles to claim the best sunbathing spot.
meanings.sent5: The inchworm outcrawled its peers, reaching the top of the twig first.
